meanings.definition: To make or become stiff or rigid.
meanings.sent1: She stiffened her back when the teacher called on her.
meanings.sent2: The old book's pages stiffened over time.
meanings.sent3: The cat stiffened its tail in protest when the dog came near.
meanings.sent4: His resolve stiffened like steel as he faced the challenge.
meanings.sent5: The cold wind stiffened the branches of the trees, making them crackle.

meanings.definition: To make or become less flexible or pliant.
meanings.sent1: The heat stiffened the plastic, making it hard to bend.
meanings.sent2: His muscles stiffened after the long workout.
meanings.sent3: The cookie dough stiffened in the fridge, ready to be rolled out.
meanings.sent4: Her attitude stiffened when she realized she was being lied to.
meanings.sent5: The lack of water stiffened the once lush plants in the garden.
